alt: This year's Lalbaugcha Raja idol was unveiled in Mumbai yesterday September 6(Photo: X/LalbaugchaRaja)
description: The image depicts a richly decorated statue of Lord Ganesha, the Hindu deity known for his elephant head and role as the remover of obstacles. The statue is set against a backdrop of ornate, golden walls that feature intricate patterns and designs, suggesting a temple or a place of worship. The deity is seated on a throne, holding a lotus flower in his right hand and an axe in his left, which are traditional symbols of his power to destroy obstacles. He is adorned with a red and gold robe, a crown, and a necklace, indicating his divine status. The statue is surrounded by smaller figures that appear to be other deities or attendants, adding to the grandeur of the scene. The overall style of the image is vibrant and detailed, with a focus on the religious and cultural significance of the deity.
article_heading: Ganesh Chaturthi 2024: The history and divinity of the majestic Lalbaugcha Raja

alt: The idol of Lord Ganesha at Lalbaugcha Raja Sarvajanik Ganeshotsav Mandal in Mumbai. (PTI)
description: The image depicts a vibrant and ornate representation of Lord Ganesha, a deity revered in Hinduism. The figure is centrally positioned and is the main focus of the image. Lord Ganesha is known for his elephant head, which is prominently displayed in the image. He is holding a lotus flower in his right hand, a symbol of purity and enlightenment, and a trident in his left hand, a weapon often associated with the deity's power to protect and destroy evil. The figure is adorned with a variety of jewelry and ornaments, including a crown, earrings, and bracelets, which are richly decorated with intricate designs. The colors used in the image are predominantly gold, blue, and red, which are considered auspicious in Hindu culture. The background features ornate architectural elements, including arches and decorative patterns, which add to the grandeur of the scene. The image is likely a photograph taken within a temple or a place of worship, given the elaborate and sacred nature of the depiction. The lighting and composition of the image suggest a sense of reverence and respect for the deity.
